1.title: Groen voor stadsmussen
1.plot: In the first episode of Groenland, host Bartel Van Riet goes to the city, because sparrows also have a need for green. With the slogan 'green up your neighbourhood' Bartel explains step by step how you can build your own sidewalk garden. To get inspired, he goes peeking over the walls and visits three divirgent city gardens. The episode ends with Bartel on a roof terrace in the crowded capital. With a refreshing cocktail, made with ingredients of own cultivation, he enjoys the skyline by sunset.

2.title: Oogsten geblazen
2.plot: Time to harvest today in Groenland. Bartel repeals to the field and goes harvesting biovegtables at the self harvest farm Wijveld. Carrots and lettuce play the key role. Cyriel, Maurice, Marie-Therese and Madeleine, occupants of rest home Sint-Jozef, prove that there's no maximum age for gardening. They're the proud owners of a vegetable garden on hip height. Beside the vegetables fruit can not be lacking here. From apple to pear and from blossom to juice; Bartel sees the beautiful Limburg from nearby.

3.title: Kiezen of Delen
3.plot: September is the perfect period to choose permanent plants. The late summer is a beautiful moment to transform your borders, to plant and replant till you create an "Indian Summer" atmosphere. Bartel goes crazy with ornamental grass and spreads bulbs. The fact that you can choose to share your garden, is something Bartel learns from Koen from Leuven. He loves to share his garden and fruits with his neighbors end friends.

4.title: De perfecte pelouze
4.plot: The Fleming is proud of his lawn, no matter if it's the size of a handkerchief or a soccer pitch. Is the grass on the other side always greener? No worries, Bartel gives the best tips and tricks, from sowing till mowing. Bartel learns how to take good care of your lawn from greenkeeper Krist, he is the lawnmaster of a golf club from Ieper.

5.title: Allemaal beestjes
5.plot: Big insects, small insects, crawling, flying or biting insects. Today they're omnipresent in Groenland. Why do butterflies love nettles? What to do with a bird that has flown against a window? And why will we never look the same at the Vooruit in Ghent again? Bartel figures it all out.

6.title: Herfstboeket
6.plot: The fall reminds everyone of cosy forestwalks, picking up nuts and spotting mushrooms. Together with forest ranger Johan Cordier, Bartel goes sniffling the fall atmosphere in Kluisbos. In the garden, Bartel takes on the contest with the fallen leafs and he gives a golden tip to handle your own snips of wood. The episode ends in fire and flames with selfmade roasted chestnuts. The fall has officially reached Groenland.

7.title: Eco-Tuinieren
7.plot: Eco what? Eco-gardening, everyone has heard of it. But what's the difference between an ordinary garden and an eco-garden. Does ecological gardening make sense? Bartel shuns no earthworms or compost and puts on his naughty rubber boots to show us the world of ecology.

8.title: Hoge Bomen
8.plot: Bartel could have a long discussion about trees. But he doesn't do that. Bartel is going to pick a tree and plant it. Sus and Gijs welcome Bartel in their personalized treehouse. If Bartel is made out of the good wood, is something he can prove by competing against an expert in climbing of tree. May the best climber win.

9.title: Allerheiligen
9.plot: All Saints Day is coming so there's some work to be done in Groenland. The green landscape on cemetery Schoonselhof, known as the Antwerp 'Père-Lachaise', needs to look posh before the first of November and this takes a lot of work and manpower. Bartel discovers in the chrysanthemum plantation through which journey a little sprout has to go to become a suitable chrysanthemum. There is no pumpkin safe before Halloween, because Bartel transforms them to a lantern.

10.title: Winterklaar
10.plot: The days become shorter and colder. The garden needs to be winterproof before the frost starts. Bartel gives terrace pots and plants an extra coat and sends his Mediterranean plants on a vacation to the planthotel. Also the animals are not forgotten. Bartel follows an herd of Scottish Galloway cattle to their new fall residence.

11.title: Kamerplanten en aanverwanten
11.plot: Not only outside we want to enjoy the plants, also inside our house we like some extra colour and green. Bartel shows us how you can have years of fun with your indoor plants if you give them the right care. Also exotic species get a chance: from the traditional cactus till the invasive pond plant. Today you get to know them all in Groenland.

12.title: Vurige herfstkleuren
12.plot: Bartel is on fire today. He gets deluded by the riches and stunning fallcolors of Heverleebos. Together with landscape architect Chris Ghyselen he goes exploring a real fallgarden. To build up some extra resistance, Bartel brews his own cup of rosehip tea. Lovely.

13.title: Binnen of Buiten
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

14.title: Lekker gezellig
14.plot: The holidays are coming and it starts tickling, Bartel searches the perfect Christmas tree. Also the birds outside long for a cosy nest and get treated with cake. Enjoyment we get by the fireplace with homemade wood and a steamy cup of hot chocolate.

15.title: Decoreren
15.plot: The need to decorate has taken over in Groenland. Florist Jill Ceulemans teaches Bartel how to make beautiful decorations with material from your own garden. Also the green service from Leuven starts decorating: Bartel can climb in the 18 meter Christmas tree and help decorating the crib. And in Hasselt residential areas compete for the title of best decorated street.

16.title: Merry Xmas
16.plot: Groenland brings you into the mood for an heartwarming Christmas. In the hope for some kisses under the mistletoe, Bartel goes to harvest one in the rustic Limburg. Topflorists Ann Desmet and Olivier Petillion teach us how we can transform or interior and exterior to a gorgeous party set. Finally Bartel gets cosy in the backyard with some friends, Glühwein and a crackling small fire with warm marshmallows.

17.title: Happy New Year
17.plot: For a lot of people the new year starts with a hangover. Headache or not, Bartel dives in the garden searching for fresh ingredients for his anti-hangover drink. On the new garden calendar we can read that it's time to trim the apple tree and brush up the tools. We explore the new garden trends for 2012 together with Bartel in three salience garden designs.

18.title: Groen werkt!
18.plot: Plants at work create more atmosphere, improve the air quality and boost the productivity. Three good reasons for Bartel to start the contest. The clean desk policy is over, time for the green desk policy. With this slogan, the office of één-netmanager Jean Philip De Tender gets a green make-over. To finish, Bartel pimps the VRT-tower with moss graffiti.

19.title: Winter Wonderland
19.plot: Today Bartel goes to the Ardennen, hoping to be able to spot some wild life. The soft temperatures this winter are perfect to make a big nature walk. Also in the garden there are some things to explore. Here the winter blossoms steal the show. Bartel goes to the plantation and gets seduced by the Helleborussen and toverhazelaars. Bartel gets warm again in Tielen where the annual Christmas tree burning attracts a lot of visitors.

20.title: Warm of Koud?
20.plot: Drastic temperature fluctuations in Groenland. In Deurne Bartel discovers the revitalising effect from a fresh dive accompanied by some polar bears. We can get inspiration from the modern wellness garden in Westerlo where the jacuzzi and outdoor shower make the temperature increase. Today the conservatory gets a profound clean up.

21.title: Knotten en vlechten
21.plot: In Eppegem Bartel starts a fight with extraordinary pollard willows. To prevent them from tearing out, they need a sturdy pollarding treatment. He gets to work with willows to braid a handy home garden bin. A sweat lodge can also not be lacking today. Prepare yourself for a steamy episode of Groenland.

22.title: Recyclage
22.plot: Within a couple of days it's Valentine Day and the love has also reached Groenland. In this episode we follow the roses route from grower and auction to the flower shop. During an exclusive workshop flower arranging for men, Bartel discovers how much love it takes to create a passionate bouquet. Finally Bartel prepares himself for a romantic date at home. With some materials from his garden, he turns his bathroom into a love place with handmade soap and a steamy hot bath with rose leafs.

23.title: Fleur d'amour
23.plot: Within a couple of days it's Valentine Day and the love has also reached Groenland. In this episode we follow the roses route from grower and auction to the flower shop. During an exclusive workshop flower arranging for men, Bartel discovers how much love it takes to create a passionate bouquet. Finally Bartel prepares himself for a romantic date at home. With some materials from his garden, he turns his bathroom into a love place with handmade soap and a steamy hot bath with rose leafs.

24.title: Olla Vogala
24.plot: Today the expression "Smile for the camera" gets a whole new meaning, since February is the ideal month to go bird watching. Bartel provides an ideal shelter for a young family of great tits in the garden. For whom prefers a natural alternative, Bartel introduces a mixed hedge, the ultimate bird paradise.

25.title: Wintertenen
25.plot: With no doubt, we all felt how cold it can be in February. Bartel can not wait to put on his ice skates today. Today we start with the build of a cold greenhouse to put forward the sowing season. The flowers also get a chance; the snow-drops, the gracious irises and the sweet-smelling Sarcococca.

26.title: Een zwaluw maakt de lente niet
26.plot: When the days get longer, the spring feeling gets stronger, even though it's temporary chilly. Reasons enough to start a sturdy clean up in the garden. You can find some more rest in the animal kingdom. The bats in the fort of Haasdonk don't let themselves disturb during their hibernation. Bartel discovers the charms of a winterproof garden design in two very divergent garden visits.

27.title: Groen in actie
27.plot: In this episode of Groenland, Bartel wants to underline the issues of green in the city. In the heart of the Marollen we discover how the presence of a green roof can stimulate the biodiversity in the city. Armed with a basket full of seeds, Bartel goes as a true Guerrilla Gardener to fallow land of our capital to transform it into a florid flower place. Finally we plant a gorgeous big linden tree nearby the Big Market of Aalst.

28.title: Lentekriebels
28.plot: Bartel goes to the wonderful Bruges to stake out young swans on the canal. The local green service is trying their best to put the city in green. Bartel is moving, he's going to sow the first vegetables in a cold bin and flourish the first spring flowers. We end this episode with a good sip of birchenjuice, because the inner human may not be forgotten today.

29.title: Natte voeten
29.plot: With the risk of getting wet feet, today Bartel goes with his kayak to the Witte Nete. Together with scientist Alain De Vocht he tries to survey the fish population. In the garden, a clean-up from the pond is necessary. If you want to enjoy a neat pond in the summer, you need to undertake some steps now. The toads who want to move from the green Hoeilaart and Overijse get some help with their big crossing.

30.title: Jeugdig groen
30.plot: Easter holidays has started so Bartel gets inspired by the youth. In Mol-Ezaart, teacher Bart calls for the help of Bartel to green up the primary school. A question you don't need to ask him twice. Bartel needs every helping hand to bring this mission to a successful end. Today all green kids from Flanders get encouraged to participate in the 'Garden champion from Flanders'.

31.title: De kip & het ei
31.plot: The Easter bunny has also visited Groenland. Today the chicken and goose eggs get a chance beside the chocolate eggs. The church of Zwijndrecht gets decorated with beautiful floral work from Stefan van Berlo. And there's good news for whom is planning to keep chickens. Bartel shares some good tips for the ultimate henhouse. Happy Easter.

32.title: Citygreen
32.plot: You don't need to live on the countryside to be able to enjoy the fresh air and home-made vegetables. Today Bartel shows us how you can make your own pallet garden on your city terrace. In Leuven, he helps out a student residence to transform their boring court into a gorgeous outside room, ideal for a sunny BBQ. Finally Bram and Yves show, with a lot of pride, their salience garden located at the heart of the harbour in Ghent. Prepare yourself for an extra green episode of Groenland.

33.title: De Floriade
33.plot: Bartel is cheating today. Groenland travels to Dutch Limburg's Venlo where the world horticulture Expo 'Floriade' takes place from the beginning of April till the beginning of October. Bartel goes on an adventure with a healthy portion of curiosity. First stop is the Belgian pavilion.

34.title: Flower Power
34.plot: In April we get treated with an explosion of flowers, but it can still be chilly at night. Bartel takes a look in the fruit nursery to protect the blossoms against night frost. But Bartel himself is neither standing still. With the slogan "one single flower tells just as much as a grand bouquet", he goes together with florist Stijn Simaeys out to surprise the people on the street with a flower. And we continue putting the flowers outside. In the Hallerbos we enjoy an unique carpet of hyacinths.

35.title: Puur genieten
35.plot: The temperatures are increasing and the days get longer, therefore the perfect moment for a garden party. Bartel proves you don't need a lot to do that. You can make a cosy bar with just some fruit boxes for example. The party garden of Filip is less back to basic. No costs or efforts were saved for making the Communion of daughter Julie an unforgettable day. In Leuven he lawn chairs were also brought up. The senior association enjoys the sun in their cosy garden. Of course a petanque track can not be lacking here.

36.title: Meimaand, Mariamaand
36.plot: The second Sunday of May is the holiday for all our mothers. Bartel doesn't want this day to pass just like that. But first we start with the mother of all mothers: the Holy virgin Maria, who gets worshipped in thousands of chapels in Flanders. In May it is tradition to cover these chapels with flowers. Bartel meets some proud chapel keepers. Another tradition in May: the Mayboose or 'Maitrank' based on sweet woodruff. Herb woman Winiefred teaches Bartel how to make this by yourself. They make some more sweets from the garden: soup from dandelions and junket with ...

37.title: De Boom in!
37.plot: Today is an episode where we want to plant trees. Because today everything is about trees. Firstly Bartel looks for the right tree for his garden. If a tree is decent or not, depends on different factors. With the help of the tree-indicator, you can explore which tree fits best with your garden. In the arboretum in Klamthout you can be admitted for a collection of diverge and usually spectacular tree types. Bartel gets a tour from Wolf who's a passionate tree caretaker for already more than 40 years. But trees are not only pretty to look at, they're also good as trial...

38.title: Groene Kunst
38.plot: The episode of today is about art. Art with trees, art with flowers and art with recycled material. In the nature area the Kalkense meersen Bartel meets artist Will Beckers, who wants to accentuate the human presence in a landscape with his land art. Of course we can't skip our visit to flower artist Daniel Ost. His loyal fans are from Japan, but earlier he flourished the Oscars and both the royal weddings. Bartel follows him while he finishes his flower artwork for the exhibition "Bouquet for Bruges". But art in the garden doesn't always need to be big or expensive. ...

39.title: Mannen en hun tuinkot
39.plot: Men who own a garden house live longer. At least, according to a British study. The fact is that the ones who love gardening, enjoy life. Bartel takes a look at three unique garden houses and talks to the pride owners. The scythe makes his comeback in the garden house. After being pushed away for years by the lawn-mower, the instrument of the Grim Reaper has found his way back to our garden. You can now even follow a class for it. Bartel tries it out. Finally we meet the new generation of garden contractors. Three teams of students garden construction and garden ...

40.title: Beauty & the Beast
40.plot: If you want to enjoy some colour and aroma in the beginning of the year, blue rain is definitely recommended. Bartel visits a grower of vines and deepens in the different sorts of blue rains. Furthermore he gets some cultivating tips from an expert. Spring is almost over and that means the perfect moment for the summer shave of the sheep. Bartel goes out with shepherd Koen and he may also use the trimmer. We finish in beauty, cause at the end of such a warm day what's better than a refreshing bath in open air?

41.title: Bloemen en zomersproeten
41.plot: The 20th of June is cleaning woman's day. To give this holiday the interest it deserves, Bartel gives some cleaning woman the surprise of their life. Of course he does that in a typical Bartel's way. A city tour along the most tasty addresses of Brussels' turns into a new dimension for Bartel. City survivors An and Lieven show him that you can live perfectly from what grows between the grass and the sidewalk stones. Luckily there's also something tasty on the menu. Bartel and his self-made BBQ get company from no one less than Jeroen Meus.

42.title: Volkstuinen En Co.
42.plot: More and more people cultivate their own vegetables. The vegetable garden is hip again. The ones who don't have a garden, don't need to panic. In most cities you can rent a little garden for a small amount. A berry bush is delicious and looks good in every garden. Unfortunately birds think the same way. Bartel shows how you can easy make a fruit cage to protect your harvest. We stay a bit longer in the garden. More and more gardeners switch to an ecological approach. It's more natural, healthier and you can do it in group. Bartel visits an eco-friendly vegetable ...

43.title: On the Road
43.plot: You don't need to sit in your garden to enjoy a beautiful piece of nature. There are also unexpected places where you can discover green treasures like for example alongside the ring road of Brussels. Stefan spotted a piece of green along one of the busiest rail tracks of Ghent. Before it was a dumping-ground for garbage, now it's a wild plant playground of 1000 m3. But also the city itself works on an innovative way to create more green. Like for example in Hasselt, where they made a vertical garden.

imdb.plot outline: It's a veritable oasis of calm and green, where week by week we follow the effects of the ever changing seasons on both the garden and the natural world and how to incorporate them into a gardening agenda. Full of outdoor and gardening tips and info, from everything you need to know about city or railway siding gardens, foraging in parks, choosing the right climbing plants, clipping trees and shrubs, using traditional tools, gardening without pesticides and late summer lawn care, to ecologically sustainable planting, preparing hedgehogs for hibernation, constructing bird houses, making vertical gardens, and establishing your own herb garden in order to ensure the tastiest mojitos!
imdb.title: Groenland
plot: Looking for a breath of fresh air in a busy programming schedule to replenish body and soul with a well needed walk in nature - then it's time to visit Greenland.

It's a veritable oasis of calm and green, where week by week we follow the effects of the ever changing seasons on both the garden and the natural world and how to incorporate them into a gardening agenda. Full of outdoor and gardening tips and info, from everything you need to know about city or railway siding gardens, foraging in parks, choosing the right climbing plants, clipping trees and shrubs, using traditional tools, gardening without pesticides and late summer lawn care, to ecologically sustainable planting, preparing hedgehogs for hibernation, constructing bird houses, making vertical gardens, and establishing your own herb garden in order to ensure the tastiest mojitos!
